00140    /*
00141    * Constructor.
00142    */
00143    template <class Data>
00144    DArray<Data>::DArray() 
00145     : Array<Data>()
00146    {}
00147 
00148    /*
00149    * Copy constructor.
00150    *
00151    * Allocates new memory and copies all elements by value.
00152    *
00153    *\param other the DArray to be copied.
00154    */
00155    template <class Data>
00156    DArray<Data>::DArray(const DArray<Data>& other) 
00157     : Array<Data>()
00158    {
00159       // Precondition
00160       if (!other.isAllocated()) {
00161          UTIL_THROW("Other DArray must be allocated.");
00162       }
00163 
00164       data_     = new Data[other.capacity_];
00165       capacity_ = other.capacity_;
00166       for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00167          data_[i] = other.data_[i];
00168       }
00169 
00170    }
00171 
00172    /*
00173    * Destructor.
00174    */
00175    template <class Data>
00176    DArray<Data>::~DArray()
00177    {
00178       if (data_) {
00179          delete [] data_;
00180       }
00181    }
00182 
00183    /*
00184    * Assignment, element-by-element.
00185    *
00186    * This operator will allocate memory if not allocated previously.
00187    *
00188    * \throw Exception if other DArray is not allocated.
00189    * \throw Exception if both DArrays are allocated with unequal capacities.
00190    *
00191    * \param other the rhs DArray 
00192    */
00193    template <class Data>
00194    DArray<Data>& DArray<Data>::operator = (const DArray<Data>& other) 
00195    {
00196       // Precondition
00197       if (!other.isAllocated()) {
00198          UTIL_THROW("Other DArray must be allocated.");
00199       }
00200 
00201       // Check for self assignment
00202       if (this == &other) return *this;
00203 
00204       if (!isAllocated()) {
00205          allocate(other.capacity());
00206       } else if (capacity_ != other.capacity_) {
00207          UTIL_THROW("Cannot assign DArrays of unequal capacity");
00208       }
00209 
00210       // Copy elements
00211       for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00212          data_[i] = other[i];
00213       }
00214 
00215       return *this;
00216    }
00217 
00218    /*
00219    * Allocate the underlying C array.
00220    *
00221    * Throw an Exception if the DArray has already allocated.
00222    *
00223    * \param capacity number of elements to allocate.
00224    */
00225    template <class Data>
00226    void DArray<Data>::allocate(int capacity) 
00227    {
00228       if (!(data_ == 0)) {
00229          UTIL_THROW("Cannot re-allocate a DArray");
00230       }
00231       if (capacity <= 0) {
00232          UTIL_THROW("Cannot allocate a DArray with capacity <= 0");
00233       }
00234       data_     = new Data[capacity];
00235       capacity_ = capacity;
00236    }
00237 
00238    /*
00239    * Deallocate the underlying C array.
00240    *
00241    * Throw an Exception if this DArray is not allocated.
00242    */
00243    template <class Data>
00244    void DArray<Data>::deallocate() 
00245    {
00246       if (!data_) {
00247          UTIL_THROW("Array is not allocated");
00248       }
00249       delete [] data_;
00250       data_ = 0;
00251       capacity_ = 0;
00252    }
00253 
00254    /*
00255    * Return true if the DArray has been allocated, false otherwise.
00256    */
00257    template <class Data>
00258    inline bool DArray<Data>::isAllocated() const 
00259    {  return !(data_ == 0); }
00260 
00261 
00262    /*
00263    * Pack this DArray into a memory block.
00264    */
00265    template <class Data>
00266    void DArray<Data>::pack(char*& current, char* end) const 
00267    {
00268       if (current + packedSize() > end) {
00269          UTIL_THROW("Attempted write past end of send buffer");
00270       }
00271 
00272       int* capacityPtr = (int*)current;
00273       *capacityPtr = capacity_;
00274       
00275       Data* ptr = (Data *)(capacityPtr + 1);
00276       for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00277          *(ptr+i) = data_[i];
00278       }
00279       current = (char*)(ptr + capacity_);
00280    }
00281 
00282    /*
00283    * Unpack this DArray from a memory block.
00284    */
00285    template <class Data>
00286    void DArray<Data>::unpack(char*& current, char* end)
00287    {
00288       if (current + packedSize() > end) {
00289          UTIL_THROW("Recv buffer too small");
00290       }
00291  
00292       int* capacityPtr = (int*)current;
00293       capacity_ = *capacityPtr;
00294 
00295       int  capacityOther = *capacityPtr;
00296       if (capacity_ != capacityOther) {
00297          UTIL_THROW("Inconsistent DArray capacities");
00298       }
00299       
00300       Data* ptr = (Data *)(capacityPtr+1);
00301       for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00302          data_[i] = *(ptr+i);
00303       }
00304       current = (char*)(ptr + capacity_);
00305    }
00306 
00307    /*
00308    * Pack this DArray into a PackedData object.
00309    */
00310    template <class Data>
00311    void DArray<Data>::pack(PackedData& buffer) const 
00312    {
00313       buffer.pack(capacity_);
00314       buffer.pack(data_, capacity_);
00315    }
00316 
00317    /*
00318    * Unpack this DArray from a PackedData object.
00319    */
00320    template <class Data>
00321    void DArray<Data>::unpack(PackedData& buffer)
00322    {
00323       int capacity;
00324       buffer.unpack(capacity);
00325       if (capacity_ != capacity) {
00326          UTIL_THROW("Inconsistent DArray capacities");
00327       } 
00328       buffer.unpack(data_, capacity_);
00329    }
00330 
00331    /*
00332    * Return packed sizeof this DArray, in bytes.
00333    */
00334    template <class Data>
00335    int DArray<Data>::packedSize() const
00336    {
00337       int size;
00338       size = capacity_*sizeof(Data) + sizeof(int);
00339       return size;
00340    }
00341 
00342    /*
00343    * Serialize a DArray to/from an Archive.
00344    */
00345    template <class Data>
00346    template <class Archive>
00347    void DArray<Data>::serialize(Archive& ar, const unsigned int version)
00348    {
00349       int capacity;
00350       if (Archive::is_saving()) {
00351          capacity = capacity_;
00352       }
00353       ar & capacity;
00354       if (Archive::is_loading()) {
00355          if (!isAllocated()) {
00356             if (capacity > 0) {
00357                allocate(capacity);
00358             }
00359          } else {
00360             if (capacity != capacity_) {
00361                UTIL_THROW("Inconsistent DArray capacities");
00362             }
00363          }
00364       }
00365       for (int i = 0; i < capacity_; ++i) {
00366          ar & data_[i];
00367       }
00368    }
